intro: Moraea graminicola subsp. graminicola, commonly known as the grass-leaved moraea, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows in grassland habitats and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes other ornamental and economically important plants. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and botanical collections.
